medical_history.chief_complaint: Cough, pain in the left shoulder, and a radio-graphically lucent lesion in the scapula.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain in the left shoulder developed approximately 2.5 months ago, initially intermittent but then constant. Two months prior to evaluation, a cough productive of greenish sputum developed without hemoptysis, chest pain, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, weight loss, or fatigue. The cough responded to antibiotics but recurred. Pain is constant, aching, and throbbing (score of 5/10), worsened by lying on his side, raising arms, lifting objects, or moving his neck. Pain lessened with rest and narcotic analgesia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of bipolar disorder and appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from metastatic colon cancer at age 68; mother has Pagetâ€™s disease, brother has diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked one to two packs of cigarettes per day for the past 3 years, more than two packs per day during the past several months; does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs; works in an office.
